column4: I see. And they're all connected at the same time, I suppose, Guest82417?
(Also, please change your name, I'm sure you're more creative than that.)
There's quite a few of us with ice* here :D
check in  /var/log/Xorg.0.log to see how X is recognising it
Thanks, looking at it now.
I think I've seen that before... it's uhm... one sec
otherwise, /var/log/dmesg should say something
e.g.:  tail /var/log/dmesg | grep keyboard
It goes by "xorg" "pc105" "us" in /var/log/Xorg.0.log
any mention of the model in dmesg?
Also, grep -v keyboard /var/log/dmesg returns nothing.
[    0.692103] input: AT Translated Set 2 keyboard as /devices/platform/i8042/serio0/input/input1
hmm, not much info :(
Well ... so no other ideas at the moment? :)
eh, you could try lshw or lshw-gtk (gui version). it's a nice tool to have anyway.
http://packages.ubuntu.com/karmic/lshw-gtk
yeah
i hope so
No luck, the only lines with keyboard in them are referring to which interrupt the keyboard takes :P
Thanks, but I'll come back and ask again :)
ok :)
